data.title: Mary Lee Obituary - La Vernia, Texas
data.meta_description: Mary Heddy Lee                                                                        1919 - 2015  Mary Heddy Lee, age 95, passed away peacefully into the arms of Jesus on Tuesday, April 14, 2015. She was born in Giddings Texas to Herman and Anna Matthijetz of Wendish descent.  She is survived by her four daughters; Laveda Thompson (Karl); Linda Rosinbaum (Jim); Lorell Kay Lake; and Carroll Dorsett (Bill).  She is survived by her brother, Carl Matthijetz, Brother-in-Law, Ike Woods and grandchildren; Howard Dorsett (Beth); Stacie Jackson (Tom ) Susan Thompson; Patrick Lake (Amy); John Thompson (Kelli), and Kellie Montoya (John).   She is survived by fourteen great grandchildren; Michael Coble, Megan Lindsey, Katie, Kyle, and Kohl Dorsett, Eric and Karlie Shelton, Hayden and Leah Thompson, Madison and Austin Montoya, Elliot, Marie, and Wyatt Lake, and four nephews.  She was preceded in death by her husband Willious R. Lee; her sisters Louise Schulz and Florence Woods and brother, John Matthijetz.  Mary, affectionately known as “Nanny” was a homemaker and loved by all.  As a lifelong Lutheran and faithful worker in Lutheran Women’s activities, she served her Lord with joy and gladness. One of her favorite Bible verses was:  “Be thou faithful unto death and I will give you a crown of life.” Revelations 2:10   She has now received her crown. Visitation will be on Tuesday, April 21st from 6 to 8 pm at Finch Funeral Home in La Vernia, Texas.  Funeral Services will be held at Immanuel Lutheran Church, La Vernia TX, on Wednesday, April 22, 2015 at 9:30 a.m.  Burial will follow at 11:00 am at Fort Sam Houston National Cemetery, in San Antonio, Texas.  In lieu of flowers family request memorials to Immanuel Lutheran Church, P O Box 168, La Vernia, TX 78121. You are welcome to sign the online guest book at www.finchfuneralchapels.com.
data.text:
Mary Heddy Lee

1919 - 2015

Mary Heddy Lee, age 95, passed away peacefully into the arms of Jesus on Tuesday, April 14, 2015. She was born in Giddings Texas to Herman and Anna Matthijetz of Wendish descent. She is survived by her four daughters; Laveda Thompson (Karl); Linda Rosinbaum (Jim); Lorell Kay Lake; and Carroll Dorsett (Bill). She is survived by her brother, Carl Matthijetz, Brother-in-Law, Ike Woods and grandchildren; Howard Dorsett (Beth); Stacie Jackson (Tom ) Susan Thompson; Patrick Lake (Amy); John Thompson (Kelli), and Kellie Montoya (John). She is survived by fourteen great grandchildren; Michael Coble, Megan Lindsey, Katie, Kyle, and Kohl Dorsett, Eric and Karlie Shelton, Hayden and Leah Thompson, Madison and Austin Montoya, Elliot, Marie, and Wyatt Lake, and four nephews. She was preceded in death by her husband Willious R. Lee; her sisters Louise Schulz and Florence Woods and brother, John Matthijetz. Mary, affectionately known as “Nanny” was a homemaker and loved by all. As a lifelong Lutheran and faithful worker in Lutheran Women’s activities, she served her Lord with joy and gladness. One of her favorite Bible verses was: “Be thou faithful unto death and I will give you a crown of life.” Revelations 2:10 She has now received her crown. Visitation will be on Tuesday, April 21st from 6 to 8 pm at Finch Funeral Home in La Vernia, Texas. Funeral Services will be held at Immanuel Lutheran Church, La Vernia TX, on Wednesday, April 22, 2015 at 9:30 a.m. Burial will follow at 11:00 am at Fort Sam Houston National Cemetery, in San Antonio, Texas. In lieu of flowers family request memorials to Immanuel Lutheran Church, P O Box 168, La Vernia, TX 78121. You are welcome to sign the online guest book at www.finchfuneralchapels.com.
